verbs.description: It [V: 's] [ARG2: very puzzling] [ARG1: that so many people who claim to hold deeply religious moral values support Donald Trump . He does n't live according to even the basic tenets of his alleged faith . He never feels he does anything wrong let alone have the need to repent and ask God for forgiveness no matter how incredibly immoral or depraved his actions are] . Put another way , Trump has never been someone who says to himself " That 's immoral , I wo n't do it . " He epitomizes the term " Christian in name only ( Chino ) . " And yet many of these same religious people attacked Barack Obama on religious grounds despite the fact that he regularly goes to church and very much lives according to the religious values they claim everyone should have . So it seems their core concern about the religious values of the president quickly disappears depending on whether the person has an " R " or " D " after their name . When pushed for an answer for why they support Trump despite his un - Christian ways , many of his religious supporters cite his willingness to appoint judges and justices that reflect their politics -- even if many of them are barely qualified to be lawyers , let alone judges . So ...

It 's very puzzling that [ARG0: so many people] [R-ARG0: who] [V: claim] [ARG1: to hold deeply religious moral values] support Donald Trump . He does n't live according to even the basic tenets of his alleged faith . He never feels he does anything wrong let alone have the need to repent and ask God for forgiveness no matter how incredibly immoral or depraved his actions are . Put another way , Trump has never been someone who says to himself " That 's immoral , I wo n't do it . " He epitomizes the term " Christian in name only ( Chino ) . " And yet many of these same religious people attacked Barack Obama on religious grounds despite the fact that he regularly goes to church and very much lives according to the religious values they claim everyone should have . So it seems their core concern about the religious values of the president quickly disappears depending on whether the person has an " R " or " D " after their name . When pushed for an answer for why they support Trump despite his un - Christian ways , many of his religious supporters cite his willingness to appoint judges and justices that reflect their politics -- even if many of them are barely qualified to be lawyers , let alone judges . So ...

He never feels he does anything wrong let alone have the need to repent and ask God for forgiveness no matter how incredibly immoral or depraved his actions are . Put another way , Trump has never been someone who says to himself " That 's immoral , I wo n't do it . " He epitomizes the term " Christian in name only ( Chino ) . " And yet many of these same religious people attacked Barack Obama on religious grounds despite the fact that he regularly goes to church and very much lives according to the religious values they claim everyone should have . So it [V: seems] [ARG1: their core concern about the religious values of the president quickly disappears depending on whether the person has an " R " or " D " after their name . When pushed for an answer for why they support Trump despite his un - Christian ways , many of his religious supporters cite his willingness to appoint judges and justices that reflect their politics -- even if many of them are barely qualified to be lawyers , let alone judges . So] ...
